com.revature.controllers

Class CarController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revature.controllers.CarController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/cars")
 @CrossOrigin
public class CarController
extends Object
    CarController takes care of handling our requests to /cars. It provides methods that can perform tasks like all cars, car by id, car by user id, add car, update car and delete car by id.
    Author:
    Adonis Cabreja

    • Method Detail

      • getCars

        @GetMapping
public List<Car> getCars()
        HTTP GET method (/cars)
        Returns:
        A list of all the cars.

      • getCarById

        @GetMapping(value="/{id}")
public Car getCarById(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                  int id)
        HTTP GET method (/cars/{number})
        Parameters:
        id - represents the car's id.
        Returns:
        A car that matches the id.

      • getCarByUserId

        @GetMapping(value="/users/{userId}")
public Car getCarByUserId(@PathVariable(value="userId")
                                                                int userId)
        HTTP GET method (/cars/users/{userId})
        Parameters:
        userId - represents the user's id.
        Returns:
        A car that matches the user's id.

      • addCar

        @PostMapping
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Car> addCar(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                         @Valid Car car)
        HTTP POST method (/cars)
        Parameters:
        car - represents the new Car object being sent.
        Returns:
        The newly created object with a 201 code.

      • updateCar

        @PutMapping(value="/{id}")
public Car updateCar(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                 @Valid Car car)
        HTTP PUT method (/cars)
        Parameters:
        car - represents the updated Car object being sent.
        Returns:
        The newly updated object.

      • deleteCarById

        @DeleteMapping(value="/{id}")
public String deleteCarById(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                           int id)
        HTTP DELETE method (/cars/{id})
        Parameters:
        id - represents the car's id.
        Returns:
        A string that says which car was deleted.
